help.helpDescription: E' veramente necessario spiegare lo scopo di questo comando?

embedReply.title: Lista dei comandi | prefisso: {PREFIX}
embedReply.description:
[Add this bot to your server]({DISCORD_BOT_INVITE}) **|** [Website]({WEBSITE}) **|**   [Documentation](https://eduardozgz.gitbook.io/member-counter) **|** [GitHub](https://github.com/eduardozgz/member-counter-bot/)

Quick setup: `{PREFIX}setup`
Learn how to use the bot: `{PREFIX}guide`

To get more info about a command send `{PREFIX}help` plus the command name: ```
{PREFIX}help shortNumber```
**Info:** `()` means an optional parameter while `[]` means a required one

misc.errorCommandNotFound: Sorry I couldn't find help for ``{DESIRED_COMMAND}``

guide.helpDescription: Mostra una guida su come usare il bot
guide.explanation:
**Grazie per aver aggiunto Member Counter al tuo server!**
__**Crea/modifica un contatore**__
Per questo esempio utilizzeremo `{members}`, che conta il numero totale di membri nel tuo server discord, ma troverai altri contatori nelle prossime pagine
Puoi piazzare un contatore in uno dei seguenti posti:

- Nel **nome** di un canale **vocale*
- Nel **nome** di un canale **categoria**
- Nell'**argomento** di un canale **testuale**
- Nell'**argomento** di un canale di **notizie**

Ora crea un nuovo canale, modificalo e scrivi `{members}` nel nome o nell'argomento, poi premi 'salva modifiche'

Puoi anche aggiungere multipli contatori al nome/argomento, e combinarli con i tuoi contenuti, ad esempio:
```
{onlineMembers}/{members} Membri Online, {youtubeSubscribers:https://www.youtube.com/user/enyay} Iscritti!
{onlineMembersWithRole:614777997291028519,614816383053856769} Amministratori e moderatori online!
```

> Se raggiungi il limite dei caratteri quando modifichi il nome o l'argomento, perfavore controlla`{PREFIX}help editChannel`
> Puoi vedere le configurazioni dei contatori correnti con `{PREFIX}seeSettings`, questo è utile per aggiungere altri contatori senza disabilitare gli altri

__**Rimuovere un contatore**__
Modifica il canale e scrivi {disable} nel nome o nell'argomento, Member Counter lo rimpiazzerà con un \✅, che significa che hai rimosso tutti i contatori di quel canale con successo

Puoi anche eliminare direttamente il canale
guide.countersHeader:
__**Counters**__
> You should enable the developer mode in Discord (User Settings > Appearence > Advanced > Developer Mode)
> To get an ID, right click in a channel/role and click "Copy ID"

> Those counters with an asterisk (\*) are premium counters, get more info in `{PREFIX}help upgradeServer`

> If you wanna change the number formatting in a counter independently of the server settings, visit this [page](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/overwrite-settings), or do it manually by following this [instructions](https://github.com/eduardozgz/member-counter-bot/issues/98)

counters.name: members
counters.description: Members in your server

counters.name: membersplaying:gameName
counters.description: Counts the amount of members playing inputed game (gameName must match what is displayed on member's game status)

counters.name: approximatedOnlineMembers
counters.description: Approximated online members in your server

counters.name: onlineMembers
counters.description: Online members in your server

counters.name: offlineMembers
counters.description: Offline members in your server

counters.name: users
counters.description: Users in your server (excludes bot)

counters.name: onlineUsers
counters.description: Online users in your server (excludes bot)

counters.name: offlineUsers
counters.description: Offline users in your server (excludes bot)

counters.name: bots
counters.description: Bots in your server (excludes normal users)

counters.name: onlineBots
counters.description: Online bots in your server (excludes normal users)

counters.name: offlineBots
counters.description: Offline bots in your server (excludes normal users)

counters.name: roles
counters.description: Ruoli nel tuo server

counters.name: channels
counters.description: Canali nel tuo server (escludendo le categorie)

counters.name: membersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID
counters.description: Questo conta quanti membri hanno un ruolo o più ruoli, scrivi gli ID dei ruoli che vuoi contatore dopo il ':', e separa gli ID dei ruoli con delle virgole

counters.name: onlineMembersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID
counters.description: Come `{membersWithRole:}` ma vale solo per i membri online

counters.name: offlineMembersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID
counters.description: Come `{membersWithRole:}` ma vale solo per i membri offline

counters.name: connectedMembers
counters.description: Numero totale di membri connessi nei canali vocali

counters.name: connectedMembers:channel1ID,channel2ID
counters.description: Come `{connectedMembers}`, ma il bot conterà solamente i membri connessi in specifici canali, scrivi l'ID dei canali che vuoi contare dopo il ':`, e separa gli ID dei canali con delle virgole

counters.name: bannedMembers
counters.description: Amount of banned members in your server, the bot must have ban permissons to display this count

counters.name: membersPlaying:game name
counters.description: Counts how many members are playing a game. Example: `{membersPlaying:Minecraft}`

counters.name: http:options
counters.description: Shows the result returned by a http `GET` request. Options is a JSON object encoded in base64, this object can have the following keys: `url`: A string; with the url of the resource, `parseNumber`: A boolean; if the result is a valid number, it will be parsed and customized acording to your server's settings, `dataPath`: A string; if the response is a JSON object, you must specify the path to a key with a value that must be a string or number, the syntax of this path is similar to the syntax that JS uses to access properties and array items. If you are confused about how to setup this, here is a [tool](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/http) to create this counter

counters.name: youtubeSubscribers:channelUrl
counters.description: Displays a youtube channel subscriber count, replace channelUrl with the desired channel url

counters.name: youtubeViews:channelUrl
counters.description: Displays a youtube channel view count

counters.name: youtubeVideos:channelUrl
counters.description: Displays a youtube channel video count

counters.name: youtubeChannelName:channelUrl
counters.description: Displays a youtube channel name

counters.name: twitchFollowers:nickname
counters.description: Displays a twitch channel follower count, replace nickname with the desired channel name

counters.name: twitchViews:nickname
counters.description: Displays a twitch channel view count

counters.name: twitchChannelName:nickname
counters.description: Displays a twitch channel Name

counters.name: memeratorMemes:username
counters.description: Displays a [Memerator](https://memerator.me) user's meme count, replace username with the desired profile name

counters.name: memeratorFollowers:username
counters.description: Displays a [Memerator](https://memerator.me) user's follower count, replace username with the desired profile name

counters.name: twitterFollowers:username
counters.description: Displays the amount of followers in an account, replace username with the actual Twitter username

counters.name: countdown:targetDate:format
counters.description: Shows a countdown that will decrease to the specified target date, you can easily [generate this counter here](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/countdown) or manually creating it by replacing `targetDate` with the target date in a UNIX timestamp, and optionally `format` it with a custom format: use `%d` to show the days left, `%h` to show the hours left, `%m` to show the minutes left and `%s` to show the seconds left

counters.name: game:gameId:address
counters.description: Online players in a game server (Minecraft, Counter Strike, Rust, Ark, Team Fortress 2, GMOD, etc) Remember to replace `gameId` by one of the listed [here](https://github.com/gamedig/node-gamedig/#games-list) and `address` by the actual server address. Example: `{game:minecraft:mc.hypixel.net}`

counters.name: clock:timeZone
counters.description: Shows a clock with the time of the specified timezone, you can easily [generate this counter here](https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/utils/clock) or replace `timeZone` with a valid IANA timezone. Example: `{clock:Europe/Madrid}`

counters.name: nitro-boosters
counters.description: Shows the total amount of members boosting this server

counters.name: static:number
counters.description: Shows the given `number` with custom formatting based on the server settings

counters.name: instagramFollowers:username
counters.description: Displays the amount of followers in an account, replace username with the actual Instagram username

counters.name: sum:value1,value2,more values
counters.description: Does a sum of the specified values

counters.name: substract:value1,value2,more values
counters.description: Substracts the specified values

counters.name: multiply:value1,value2,more values
counters.description: Multiplies the specified values

counters.name: divide:value1,value2,more values
counters.description: Divides the specified values

counters.name: modulus:value1,value2,more values
counters.description: Gets the modulus of the specified values

lockChannel.helpDescription:
You can use this commands to show a lockpad (🔒) instead of a speaker (🔊) in voice channels

**Usage**```{PREFIX}lockChannel [channel id]```
 **Example**```{PREFIX}lockChannel 700336568099143710```
lockChannel.success: Done! Now, **for non admin users**, the channel will be displayed with a 🔒
lockChannel.errorInvalidChannel: You can only lock voice channels!
lockChannel.errorNoPerms: I can't edit the channel `{CHANNEL}` due to lack of permissions

editChannel.helpDescription:
If you are trying to set a counter but Discord tells you that you reached the name/topic length limit, you can use this command to "ignore" that limit
**Usage**```{PREFIX}editChannel [channelId] [content]```
**Example**```{PREFIX}editChannel 701396983843127366 {onlinemembers} of {members} Online```
editChannel.success: Done! You may have to wait a few minutes to see the new changes

setDigit.helpDescription:
Customizes numbers that will be displayed, the number argument must be a normal number, the second argument can be anything, like an emoji or a normal number, you can customize multiple numbers at once by separating the arguments with commas (`,`)
If the first argument is the word "reset", the numbers will be restored to the default ones.

Usage: ```{PREFIX}setDigit reset
{PREFIX}setDigit [number] [your custom number]```
Examples: ```{PREFIX}setDigit 3 3
{PREFIX}setDigit 3 :emoji3:, 4 :emoji4:```

shortNumber.helpDescription:
This command allows you to show a count in a compact form in counters

**Usage**
```{PREFIX}shortNumber [enable/disable]```
**Examples**```{PREFIX}shortNumber enable
{PREFIX}shortNumber disable```
shortNumber.success: Done! You may have to wait a few minutes to see the new changes

locale.helpDescription:
Formats the numbers and clocks (12h/24h format) to the specified locale

**Usage**
```{PREFIX}locale [locale/disable]```
**Examples**```{PREFIX}locale en
{PREFIX}locale es
{PREFIX}locale disable```

prefix.helpDescription:
Changes the bot prefix.

Usage:```{PREFIX}prefix [new prefix]```

role.helpDescription:
You can allow or deny roles to use bot administrative commands.
You can use ``all`` keyword to allow or deny all roles.
To see which roles are currently allowed use `{PREFIX}seeSettings`
```{PREFIX}role allow @Mod
{PREFIX}role allow @Mod @OtherRole
{PREFIX}role deny all```
role.errorNoRolesToUpdate: You must mention at least 1 role

seeSettings.helpDescription: Shows all bot settings for this server.

settingsMessage.allowedRolesText: Ruoli a cui è permesso usare comandi amministrativi:
settingsMessage.warningNoPermsText: \⚠️ = The bot cannot continue updating this channel due to lack of permissions (You must allow the bot to: Manage channel, See channel or Read Messages, Connect)

resetSettings.helpDescription: Restores the custom settings of this server to the default ones

update.helpDescription: If you think the counters are stuck use this command to update them again.
update.inProgress: Updating the counters, this may take a while.

upgradeServer.helpDescription: This command allows you to invite Member Counter Premium, to use this command you must have a premium account, which you can get by donating at least 5 USD: `{PREFIX}donate`.
upgradeServer.success:
Done! The next step is invite the premium bot:
{BOT_LINK}
upgradeServer.errorCannotUpgrade: You can't upgrade the server because it already has premium.
upgradeServer.noServerUpgradesAvailable: You can't do more server upgrades because you don't have more server upgrades available, you can check how much you have left with `{PREFIX}profile` or get more with `{PREFIX}donate`

lang.helpDescription: Changes the bot language for this server, you must have administrator permissions to run this command.

embedReply.title: Enjoying my bot? Donate me! (Click here)

donate.errorExchangeFetch: Error while trying to fetch exchange rates

profile.helpDescription: Shows related information between you and this bot
profile.removeDataConfirmation: :warning: **This action will remove all your data, your badges and server upgrades will be lost forever, are you sure you want to continue? (Ignore to cancel)**
profile.removeDataSuccess: Your data has been removed successfully

preview.helpDescription:
Shows a preview of how a counter or various counters will look in a channel

**Usage**```{PREFIX}preview [content]```
**Example**```{PREFIX}preview {members} Members```

setup.helpDescription:
Creates some locked voice channels with some counters in them
Optionally set up YouTube or Twitch channel counters
**Usage**```{PREFIX}setup
{PREFIX}setup twitch [channel name]
{PREFIX}setup youtube [channel link]```
**Example**```{PREFIX}setup
{PREFIX}setup twitch muhriaa
{PREFIX}setup youtube https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXuqSBlHAE6Xw-yeJA0Tunw```

base64.helpDescription:
A base64 utility command, useful to customize specific counters or create advanced counters like `{http}` 

**Usage**```{PREFIX}base64 [encode/decode] [data]```
 **Example**```{PREFIX}base64 encode test
{PREFIX}base64 decode dGVzdA==```
base64.invalidAction: Invalid action, it must be `encode` or `decode`

commandHandler.noDm: Non puoi eseguire questo comando in una conversazione privata

getCounts.noBanPerms: Ho bisogno dei permessi dei ban per mostrarlo
getCounts.invalidChannelLength: Lunghezza del nome del canale invalida, perfavore riesegui la configurazione del contatore

paginator.jumpPrompt: Which page would you like to go to? Type `cancel` or `0` to cancel the prompt. You have 15 seconds to reply.
paginator.errorPageLengthExceeded: The page number must be less than or equal to {TOTAL_PAGES}. Please try again.
paginator.errorNegativeInput: The page number can't be negative. Please try again.

common.errorDb: Errore del database, riprova più tardi
common.errorUnknown: Qualcosa è andato storto, riprova più tardi.
common.errorNoAdmin: Solo i membri coi permessi di amministratore di questo server possono usare questo comando.
common.noTopicCounterEnabled: Sembra che tu non abbia abilitato un contatore dell'argomento, per favore, guarda `{PREFIX}help topicCounter`
